intro: Tenicroa fragrans, commonly known as the sweet sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces a unique, fragrant resin that has been used traditionally in various medicinal applications. Its growth habit includes climbing or trailing vines, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The botanical features of Tenicroa fragrans make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and pharmacological study.
